Title: The Birds, the Bees and the Italians
Writer: Luciano Vincenzoni (story), Pietro Germi (story), Agenore Incrocci (screenplay), Furio Scarpelli (screenplay), Luciano Vincenzoni (screenplay), Pietro Germi (screenplay)
Actors: Virna Lisi, Gastone Moschin, Alberto Lionello, Olga Villi
Plot: A citizen of the Veneto in her sixties. Three stories of "love in the country": a pseudo Don Giovanni confesses his impotence to the doctor in confidence but he becomes betrayed by him - the medic speaks about his patient with some befriend gossips; a bank employee, after a tormented affair with the young waitress of a bar, returns to be single - disappointed and made bitter; some boys exploit the gratitude of an ingenuous girl from the vicinity. Her father denunciates them but withdraws all efforts after getting a compensation and saves them from jail.
Awards: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 7 wins & 1 nomination.
